question:
You work for an international company, and would like to spend six months working in its head office in another country.
write a letter to your manager. in your letter
-why you want to work in company's head office for six months
-say how your work could be done while you are away
-ask for his/her help in arranging it.
text: I am Alan White, a senior engineer in RDR department team 3. I learnt from our internal newsletter that consistent quality problems of the products from our factory in Eastern China had prompted customer complaints and higher than expected warranty costs. I am writing to volunteer myself to go there for six months to help fix these issues.

As you can ask from my immediate supervisor Mr Tom Smith, I have extensive knowledge and experience in this area, and coincidently my wife comes from Taiwan therefore I can understand Mandarin, these factors make me feel I am the right candidate for this task.

During my temporary leave, my work can be taken up by Ms Cynthia Lee in our department. She and her subordinates also have some experience in my field. In addition, actually the product quality here is very stable this year and we do not foresee much product risk in the coming six months.

I understand there is a process for the group human resources department to select the right candidate. Please let me know about the procedures I need to come across and I would be particularly interested to know about the tax implications of working there. I will be cooperative with your arrangements. Thank you in advance.

error_list.error_des: It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase actually. Consider adding a comma.
